paper_abstract: Suppose f : X* ->. X* is a morphism and u, v epsilon X*. For every nonnegative integer n, let z(n) be the longest common prefix of f(n) (u) and f(n) (v), and let u(n), v(n) epsilon X* be words such that f(n) (u) = z(n) u(n) and f(n) (v) = z(n) v(n). We prove that there is a positive integer q such that for any positive integer p, the prefixes of u(n) ( resp. v(n)) of length p form an ultimately periodic sequence having period q. Further, there is a value of q which works for all words u, v epsilon X*.
paper_title: A periodicity property of iterated morphisms
